channel.title: Data Science Portfolio on Stacy Scudder
channel.description: Recent content in Data Science Portfolio on Stacy Scudder

item.title: About
item.description: After living my life in interesting times, I decided to switch careers and finally get into the field I’ve loved since I was in my early teens. I know it’s going to be slightly more difficult to break into a new field when I’m over 50, but I have so much to offer a company that’s willing to give me a chance. Because my life hasn’t been a straight path, I’ve picked up invaluable experience that helps me see the world through many different lenses.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Platform URL GitHub: https://github.com/StacyScudder LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/stacyscudder/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/IAmMathemagical

item.title: Paranormal Playlist
item.description: About This is a recommender system that lets you enter a paranormal romance book and get back a list of 20 hair metal songs as a soundtrack. I looked around for an app or website that would let a reader create a playlist based on a book, but there weren’t any. Every recommender I found stayed within the same mediums: book to book, music to music, etc. So I thought I’d have some fun and create my own.

item.title: Personal Library
item.description: This project will incorporate pieces from several other repos dealing with book data to build a personal library. About I have a large personal library that includes books, ebooks, and audiobooks. For several years, I’ve used a free program called Calibre to manage my ebooks. Recently, I’ve thought about including my audiobooks and physical books, as well, but I’m still trying to find the best way to include everything I want.

item.title: Predicting the NBA MVP
item.description: About My grandson asked me about setting up a webpage or app with a dashboard for NCAA or NBA stats. I wanted to be able to show him how to scrape the stats and use it to make predictions before moving on to the dashboard, but I needed more practice myself before teaching him. Data For this project, I scraped data from basketball-reference since it had a table with MVP data that was easier to scrape.
